CHAPTER 8
ATTENDANCE REQUIREMENTS
SECTION:
2-8-1: Requirements; Generally
2-8-1: REQUIREMENTS; GENERALLY:
Each and every member of any board, committee, or commission, except the city
commission, shall be required to attend a majority of the meetings of said
board, committee or commission. Any member who shall fail to attend three (3)
consecutive regular meetings shall automatically, without recourse, cease to be
a member of said board, committee or commission. Any member of any board,
committee or commission, except the city commission, who shall fail to attend
more than one-half (1/2) of all meetings in the course of a year shall
automatically cease to be a member of said board, committee or commission.
(Ord. 269, 12-14-2009)
CHAPTER 9
BEAUTIFICATION AND CODE ENFORCEMENT BOARD
SECTION:
2-9-1: Purpose; Establishment Of Board
2-9-2: Composition
2-9-3: Meetings; Duties
2-9-4: Appeals
2-9-1: PURPOSE; ESTABLISHMENT OF BOARD:
The Drumright beautification and code enforcement board (the board) is hereby
established. The board shall exist as a body to assist the code enforcement
officer of the city of Drumright, identify properties in need of code
enforcement, and to notify property owners of violations of the municipal codes
pertaining to property related nuisances including, but not limited to: a)
accumulations of trash and junk on properties not zoned to permit such; b)
excessive growth of grass, weeds, other brush and dead trees; c) dilapidated or
unsecured structures in need of demolition or securing; and d) junked,
abandoned, partially dismantled or otherwise inoperable vehicles or vehicles on
property which are not current with their registration. The code enforcement
officer shall assist the board with the notification forms, the code
enforcement process, identification of property owners and filing of papers
with county officers. (Ord. 292, 11-14-2011)
2-9-2: COMPOSITION:
The board shall be composed of seven (7) members which shall be two (2) members
of the city commission and one member appointed by each of the five (5) members
of the city commission although no ward residency requirement shall be imposed.
Board members shall serve for a term of two (2) years and shall be eligible for
reappointment at the pleasure of the city commission. Members of the board
shall serve without compensation. (Ord. 292, 11-14-2011)
2-9-3: MEETINGS; DUTIES:
   A.   The board shall meet as needed and upon notice to the members of the
board at least forty eight (48) hours in advance. The board, at its first
meeting shall elect a chairman, vice chairman and secretary.
   B.   The board shall determine its own rules of procedure. The board, with
the assistance of the code enforcement officer, the city attorney and the city
manager may more fully develop its policies and procedures so long as those
policies and procedures are in compliance with Oklahoma statutes related to
abatement of nuisances.
   C.   It shall be the administrative hearing board for individuals who wish
to contest any allegation that their property is the site of a nuisance. Upon
the conclusion of any such hearing, the board shall make a determination as to
whether a nuisance exists and may order the property owner to abate such
nuisance within a time frame as determined by the board. Failure to abate such
nuisance shall constitute grounds for filing of charges against the property
owner in municipal court. (Ord. 292, 11-14-2011)
2-9-4: APPEALS:
Should any property owner be aggrieved by a ruling of the board, he may file an
appeal to the ruling within ten (10) days. The appeal shall be heard by the
city commission at the next regular meeting, provided the appeal is filed at
least five (5) days prior to the commission meeting date. If less than five (5)
days shall remain until the next regular meeting date, the appeal shall be
heard the following month. If a nuisance is considered especially grievous, a
special meeting of the city commission may be called to consider the appeal.
(Ord. 292, 11-14-2011)
TITLE 3
BUSINESS AND LICENSE REGULATIONS
CHAPTER 1
OCCUPATION TAXES AND LICENSE FEES
SECTION:
3-1-1: Purpose
3-1-2: License Required; Application; Issuance
3-1-3: Register Required
3-1-4: Conditions Of License
3-1-5: License Transfer; Revocation
3-1-6: Separate License For Each Business
3-1-7: License Lost; Duplicate
3-1-8: Taxes Or Fees Enumerated
3-1-9: Payment Of Fees; License Term
3-1-10: Exemptions
3-1-11: Failure To Obtain License Or Pay Fee
3-1-12: Penalty
3-1-1: PURPOSE:
For the purpose of protecting the public health and safety by regulating
certain trades and occupations which on account of their nature it is deemed
necessary to regulate, the occupation taxes and license fees set out in this
chapter and this title are made necessary to cover the cost of licensing,
inspecting and policing said trades and occupations and the same are hereby
levied for this purpose. (1980 Code § 5-1)
3-1-2: LICENSE REQUIRED; APPLICATION; ISSUANCE:
   A.   License Required: It is unlawful for any person, firm, or corporation,
either as principal or agent, or his servants or employees to conduct or carry
on any trade, occupation, or business hereinafter enumerated without first
having procured a license therefor from the city clerk, as hereinafter
provided.
   B.   Application For License; Issuance:
      1.   Every person, firm, or corporation desiring to engage in any trade,
occupation or business hereinafter enumerated in this chapter or this title
shall first make application to the city clerk on an application form furnished
by the city clerk for a license, and shall pay to the clerk the license fee
hereinafter prescribed.
      2.   It is the duty of the city clerk, upon receipt of such application,
and fee, if same be deemed satisfactory and acceptable, and upon fulfillment of
any other requirements of this code or the ordinances of the city, if any, to
issue a license to the applicant.
   C.   Term Of License: All licenses procured above, if they be annual
licenses, expire on June 30 following their issuance.
   D.   Taxes And Fees Levied: There are hereby levied and established
occupation taxes and license fees, as hereinafter set out, for and on each and
every person, business, occupation, profession or trade, or persons, firms and
corporations engaged therein, which are carried on, operated, or conducted,
within the corporate limits of the city. (1980 Code § 5-78)
   E.   Collection Of Fees; License Issuance:
      1.   No license shall be issued hereunder until the required amount
therefor has been paid to the city clerk, and each such license so issued shall
be signed by the mayor and city clerk, and the corporate seal of the city
affixed thereto.
      2.   Such license shall be in suitable form and express the purpose for
which it is issued.
      3.   In all cases, an application for a license must first be approved by
a designated officer or employee, as specified by ordinance, and the city clerk
shall first issue a written application for a license to the applicant who
shall present the same to such officer or employee for his approval after which
the city clerk shall issue said license upon the payment of the required fee or
tax. (1980 Code § 5-3)
3-1-3: REGISTER REQUIRED:
The city clerk shall prepare and keep a suitable register of all licenses
issued by him. (1980 Code § 5-2)
3-1-4: CONDITIONS OF LICENSE:
   A.   Compliance With Laws: All licenses shall be issued subject to the
ordinances of the city and the laws of the state. No license shall be construed
as authority to do or omit to do any act otherwise regulated or required by law
or ordinance. (1980 Code § 5-4)
   B.   Use By Licensee: No license issued under the provisions of this chapter
shall be used or worn at any time by any person other than the one to whom it
was issued.
   C.   Age Restriction: No license shall be issued to any person under the age
of sixteen (16) years, and it shall be unlawful for any licensee to employ or
allow any minor under the age of sixteen (16) years to be used as a huckster,
peddler, hawker, helper or solicitor in connection with the business licensed
thereunder. (1980 Code § 5-79)
3-1-5: LICENSE TRANSFER; REVOCATION:
No license shall be sold or otherwise transferred; and the mayor or approving
officer, as the case may be, may for cause at any time, revoke any license
granted under the ordinances of the city and the amounts that may have been
paid to the city for such license shall be forfeited to the city. (1980 Code §
5-5)
3-1-6: SEPARATE LICENSE FOR EACH BUSINESS:
Every person or firm having more than one place of business or who shall
exercise or follow more than one profession, calling or occupation shall pay
for each separately. (1980 Code § 5-6)
3-1-7: LICENSE LOST; DUPLICATE:
Whenever any original occupation license shall have been lost or destroyed, it
shall be the duty of the city clerk, on application in writing by the owner
thereof, to issue a duplicate of the same and file with the city clerk;
provided, that the same has been lost or destroyed, without any connivance on
his part, and that he has made diligent search for the same and that he has not
been able to find it. (1980 Code § 5-7)
3-1-8: TAXES OR FEES ENUMERATED:
The following license taxes or fees are levied respectively and for the
duration of time as indicated in each case:
Circuses, carnivals, skating rinks and exhibitions for which an admission is
charged: Twenty five dollars ($25.00) per day of operation, payable in advance
of opening.
Hawkers, peddlers of goods (except sellers of vegetables and produce which they
produced), wares or any other merchandise of whatever nature or other itinerant
merchants: Five dollars ($5.00) per day, twenty five dollars ($25.00) per month
or one hundred dollars ($100.00) per year.
Solicitation of subscriptions for books, magazines or other literary products
where all or a part of the price is collected at the time of the subscription:
Five dollars ($5.00) per day per individual so selling or taking subscriptions.
Vehicles or taxicabs for hire: Twenty five dollars ($25.00) per year per
vehicle.
Coin operated devices operated by the deposit of a coin or coins for dispensing
of a service or a product as follows:
For each coin operated amusement device: Twenty five dollars ($25.00) per year.
For each coin operated vending device requiring the deposit of twenty five
cents ($0.25) or more: Twenty five dollars ($25.00) per year.
For each coin operated vending device requiring the deposit of less than twenty
five cents ($0.25): Seven dollars fifty cents ($7.50) per year.
For each coin operated bulk vending device which vends one to five (5) products
through a single distribution mechanism requiring the deposit of a coin or
coins having a value of twenty five cents ($0.25) or more: Three dollars
seventy five cents ($3.75) per year.
For each coin operated bulk vending device which vends one or more products
through multiple distribution mechanisms requiring the deposit of a coin or
coins having a value of twenty five cents ($0.25) or more: Ten dollars ($10.00)
for each five (5) distribution mechanisms or any number less than five (5)
mechanisms. This number shall be determined by dividing the total number of
mechanisms by five (5) and, if a fractional number results, the number of
permits shall be rounded up.
For each coin operated bulk vending device requiring the deposit of a coin or
coins having a value of less than twenty five cents ($0.25): One dollar fifty
cents ($1.50) per year.
These annual fees shall be in lieu of sales taxes which are not collected on
these purchases.
Exemptions: The following coin operated devices shall be exempt from the
provisions of this section:
All coin operated devices owned or operated by and located on the premises of a
public or private school, a church or a governmental entity;
All coin operated devices which dispense newspapers or periodicals;
All coin operated devices which dispense only postage stamps;
All coin operated devices which dispense water at laundromats or car washes.
Permit stamps shall be issued for one calendar year, however permit stamps
issued in the second half of the year shall be prorated fifty percent (50%).
Any items sold through a vending machine for which the permit stamp has been
paid and is displayed shall be exempt from and not subject to sales tax.
Any owner or operator of a coin operated device who places such device in
service and available to the public without first affixing said permit stamp
shall be guilty of an offense and shall be liable upon conviction for a fine of
seventy five dollars ($75.00) plus court costs and the costs of the permit
stamp for each nonpermitted device.
Where any coin operated device as previously defined is placed on location
within the city of Drumright without a permit stamp affixed as provided by this
section, the device, including any cash in the receptacle thereof, shall be
considered forfeited to the city of Drumright and may be seized by any law
enforcement officer and impounded subject to a hearing in the Drumright
municipal court. The owner thereof shall be given a minimum of ten (10) days
notice of the time and date of the hearing. At the conclusion of the hearing,
the municipal court judge shall enter a finding and upon a finding of guilty,
the owner shall pay the above referenced fine and costs whereupon the city of
Drumright shall return the device(s) to the owner. (Ord. 297, 4-8-2013)
3-1-9: PAYMENT OF FEES; LICENSE TERM:
   A.   Specification Of Fees: All license fees and occupation taxes shall be
levied in such amounts as specified in section
3-1-8 of this chapter and for the time enumerated, or parts thereof, and no fee
or tax shall be levied for a less amount than specified, but for any fractional
part of the enumerated time, the full amount shall be paid as if for the full
time and all such licenses shall expire as otherwise provided by ordinance.
(1980 Code § 5-8)
   B.   Due Date; Term Of License: All license fees for the above named
occupations, and each of them, except as otherwise designated herein, shall be
and become due on June 30 of each year; and no license for the operation of any
such business or occupation shall be issued until such license fee is paid to
the city clerk; and all licenses for such occupations or businesses shall be
issued to expire on June 30 following the issuance thereof, unless otherwise
designated. (1980 Code § 5-11; amd. 2002 Code)
3-1-10: EXEMPTIONS:
There shall be no license required for persons, firms, or corporations selling
personal property at wholesale to retail merchants, nor for resident merchants
or their employees in taking orders at the homes of their customers, nor for
such resident merchants and their employees in delivering goods ordered by
their customers. Likewise, there shall be required no license for persons
selling newspapers from house to house, nor for any person, firm or corporation
selling and delivering commodities from house to house where said person, firm
or corporation has an established home or place of business within the limits
of the city. Likewise, it shall not be necessary for any farmer or truck
gardener to procure a license in order to sell, from house to house in the
city, products raised by him from lands owned, cultivated or controlled by him.
(1980 Code § 5-80)
3-1-11: FAILURE TO OBTAIN LICENSE OR PAY FEE:
Any person, firm, corporation, or association refusing to comply with or
violating any of the terms, conditions or provisions of this chapter or who
shall exercise, follow, pursue or engage in any of the occupations, businesses,
trades or professions on which an occupation tax or license fee is charged as a
condition for same, without first obtaining a license therefor, shall be deemed
guilty of an offense, and each day's violation shall constitute a separate
offense; provided, however, that any fines and costs paid on account of the
same shall in no way relieve any person, firm or corporation from the payment
of any license, tax or fee as herein provided, and shall not impair any other
legal right or remedies which the city may have. (1980 Code § 5-9)
3-1-12: PENALTY:
Any person, firm, association or corporation who shall engage in any business,
profession, trade or occupation, or exercise any privilege for which a license
is required by this title without a valid license as thereby required, or who
shall violate any provision of this title by doing any act prohibited or
declared to be unlawful thereby, or declared to be an offense or misdemeanor
thereby, or who shall fail to do any act when such provision declares such
failure to be unlawful or to be an offense or misdemeanor, shall be guilty of a
misdemeanor; and, upon conviction thereof, shall be subject to penalty as
provided in section
1-4-1 of this code. Each day upon which any such violation continues shall
constitute a separate misdemeanor. (1980 Code § 5-81; amd. 2002 Code)
CHAPTER 2
MUNICIPAL TAXES
ARTICLE C. LODGING TAX
SECTION:
3-2C-1: Citation And Codification
3-2C-2: Definitions
3-2C-3: Tax Rate
3-2C-4: Exemptions
3-2C-5: Tax To Be Separately Designated On Bills
3-2C-6: Operator's Duties
3-2C-7: Bond Required; City Collection
3-2C-8: Assessment And Determination Of Tax
3-2C-9: Refunds
3-2C-10: Notices
3-2C-11: Remedies Exclusive
3-2C-12: Agreement Of Administration
3-2C-13: General Powers Of The City Manager
3-2C-14: Certificates Of Registration
3-2C-15: Use Of Funds
3-2C-16: Records Confidential
3-2C-17: Criminal Penalties
3-2C-18: Civil Remedies
3-2C-1: CITATION AND CODIFICATION:
This article shall be known and cited as the CITY OF DRUMRIGHT LODGING TAX
ORDINANCE. (Ord. 313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-1-2015)
3-2C-2: DEFINITIONS:
As used in this article:
CITY: The city of Drumright, Oklahoma.
HOTEL: Any building or buildings, structures, trailer, or other facility in
which the public may, for consideration, obtain sleeping accommodations, and in
which rooms are used for the accommodation of such occupant whether such rooms
are in one or several structures. The term shall include hotels, apartment
hotels, motels, tourist courts, lodging houses, inns, rooming houses, and all
other facilities where rooms or sleeping facilities or space are furnished for
a consideration. The term shall not include hospitals, sanatoriums or nursing
homes.
OCCUPANCY: The use or possession, or the right to the use or possession of any
room or rooms in a hotel.
OCCUPANT: The person, who for a consideration, uses, possesses, or has the
right to the use or possession of any room or rooms in a hotel under any lease,
concession, permit, right of access, license to use, or other agreement.
OPERATOR: Any person operating a hotel within the city, including, but not
limited to, the owner, proprietor, manager, lessee, sublessee, mortgagee in
possession, licensee, or any other person otherwise operating such hotel.
PERSON: Any individual, corporation, company, partnership, voluntary
association, firm, club, society, organization or any other entity of whatever
kind or nature.
RENT: The consideration received for occupancy valued in money, whether
received in money or otherwise, including all receipts, cash credits, and
property or services of any kind or nature, and also any amount for which
credit is allowed by the operator to the occupant, without any deduction
therefrom whatsoever.
RETURN: Any report filed or required to be filed as herein provided.
ROOM: Any room or suite of rooms of any kind in any part or portion of a hotel
which is available for or let out for use or possessed for sleeping facilities.
TAX: The tax levied pursuant to this article. (Ord. 313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-1-
2015)
3-2C-3: TAX RATE:
There is hereby levied an excise tax of four percent (4%) (in addition to any
and all other excise taxes now in force) upon the gross proceeds or gross
receipts derived from all rent for every occupancy of a room or rooms in a
hotel in this city. Rooms provided free of charge, through barter, trade or any
other arrangement or agreement of any kind or nature, are also subject to such
tax at the sales value of the room so provided (with "sales value" to mean the
price at which the room would be rented to the operator's best customer in the
ordinary course of business). (Ord. 313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-1-2015)
3-2C-4: EXEMPTIONS:
The exemptions from excise tax enumerated in 68 Oklahoma Statutes, section 1350
et seq. (the "Oklahoma sales tax code"), are hereby adopted and incorporated
herein by reference. To the extent any conflicts in connection with the
permitted exemptions should arise under this article and the Oklahoma sales tax
code, the Oklahoma sales tax code shall prevail. (Ord. 313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-
1-2015)
3-2C-5: TAX TO BE SEPARATELY DESIGNATED ON BILLS:
The operator shall separately designate; charge and show the tax on all bills,
statements, receipts or any other evidence of charge or payment of rent for
occupancy issued or delivered by the operator. (Ord. 313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-1-
2015)
3-2C-6: OPERATOR'S DUTIES:
   A.   Operator Responsible For Collections: The operator shall be responsible
for the collection of the tax from the occupant and shall be liable to the city
for the tax which shall be held in trust by the operator until paid to the city
or the Oklahoma tax commission pursuant to an agreement to collect municipal
lodging taxes as set forth in 68 Oklahoma Statutes, section 2701 et seq., of
the state tax code. The operator shall join the city as a party to any action
brought by the operator to enforce collection of the tax.
   B.   Records To Be Kept: Every operator shall keep records of every
occupancy and of all rent paid, charged, or due thereon and of the tax payable
thereon in such form as the city manager or Oklahoma tax commission may by
regulation require. Such records shall be available for inspection and
examination at any time upon demand by the city manager, or a duty authorized
agent or employee of the city or the Oklahoma tax commission, and shall be
preserved for a period of three (3) years.
   C.   Returns:
      1.   In the event of collection of the tax levied pursuant to this
article by the Oklahoma tax commission, each operator shall file with the city
manager a copy of their completed Oklahoma state sales tax form within twenty
(20) days after the end of each month following the effective date hereof.
      2.   In the event of collection of the tax levied pursuant to this
article by the city, every operator shall file with the city manager a return
as prescribed by the city and shall contain such information as may be deemed
necessary and proper for the administration of this article, of any occupancy
and of rents, and of the taxes payable thereon for the period ending on the
last day of each month following the effective date hereof. Such return shall
be filed within the first twenty (20) days after the end of each such month.
The city manager may require amended returns to be filed within ten (10) days
after notice and to contain the information specified in the notice.
   D.   Payment Of Tax: The payment of the tax levied pursuant to this article
shall be due prior to the twentieth day following the month during which the
charge for the occupancy of a hotel is incurred by the occupant. At the time of
filing a return of occupancy and of rents, each operator shall pay to the city
treasurer or the Oklahoma tax commission (in the manner and form prescribed for
payment of the municipal lodging tax under the state tax law of the state of
Oklahoma) the taxes imposed by this article upon the rents included in such
return. All taxes not paid with a timely return shall be delinquent. All the
taxes for the period for which a return is required to be filed shall be due
from the operator and payable to the city treasurer or Oklahoma tax commission
on or before the date fixed for the filing of the return for such period
without regard to whether a return is filed or whether the return which is
filed correctly shows the amount of rents and the taxes due thereon.
   E.   Deduction For Recordkeeping: For so long as the operator maintains
compliance with the collection and remittance of the tax due hereunder, the
operator shall be allowed a deduction in accordance with the provisions of 68
Oklahoma Statutes, as amended, section 1367.1, as compensation for the keeping
and maintaining of sales tax records, filing reports and remitting the tax when
due.
   F.   Delinquent Taxes: All taxes not paid within twenty (20) calendar days
following the last day of the period for the collection of the tax levied by
this article shall be delinquent.
   G.   Interest And Penalties On Unpaid Taxes: If any tax levied by this
article becomes delinquent, the person responsible and liable for remittance of
such tax shall pay penalties on such unpaid tax at the rates and charges as
established in 68 Oklahoma Statutes, section 217. (Ord. 313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-
1-2015)
3-2C-7: BOND REQUIRED; CITY COLLECTION:
In the event initial collection of the tax levied hereunder shall be collected
by the city, or after such termination of an agreement of administration
authorized in section
3-2C-12 of this article, where the city manager believes that any operator is
about to cease business, leave the state, or remove or dissipate assets, or for
any other similar reason the city manager deems it necessary in order to
protect revenues under this article may require such operator to file with the
city a bond issued by a surety company authorized to transact business in the
state in such amount as the city manager may fix to secure the payment of any
tax or penalties and interest due, or which may become due from such operator.
In the event that the city manager determines that an operator is to file such
bond, the city manager shall give notice to such operator specifying the amount
of security required. The operator shall file such security as a performance
bond or irrevocable letter of credit within five (5) days after the filing of
such notice unless within such five (5) days the operator shall request in
writing a hearing before the city council, at which time the necessary
propriety and amount of the bond shall be determined by the city council. Such
determination shall be final and shall be complied with within fifteen (15)
days thereafter. In lieu of such bond, a cash or securities escrow, in an
amount and under terms approved by the city manager, may be deposited with the
city manager, who may at any time after five (5) days' notice to the depositor,
apply them to any tax and/or any penalties due and for that purpose the
securities may be sold at private or public sale. (Ord. 313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-
1-2015)
3-2C-8: ASSESSMENT AND DETERMINATION OF TAX:
If a return required by this article is not filed, or if a return when filed is
incorrect or insufficient, the amount of tax due shall be assessed by the city
manager or the Oklahoma tax commission from such information as may be
obtainable and, if necessary, the tax may be estimated on the basis of external
indices, such as number of rooms, location, scale of rents, comparable rents,
types of accommodations and services, number of employees, or other factors.
Written notice of such assessments shall be given to the person liable for the
collection and payment of the tax. Such assessment shall finally and
irrevocably fix and determine the tax:
   A.   Unless the person against whom it is assessed shall apply in writing to
the city council for a hearing within sixty (60) days after the city gives
notice of such assessment; or
   B.   Unless the city manager decides to reassess the same.
After such hearing, the city council shall give written notice of its
determination within thirty (30) days to the person against whom the tax is
assessed and such determination shall be final. (Ord. 313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-1-
2015)
3-2C-9: REFUNDS:
   A.   Procedure:
      1.   Oklahoma Tax Commission Collection Of Tax: If collection of the tax
levied pursuant to this article is delegated to the Oklahoma tax commission
pursuant to an agreement for the collection of municipally imposed lodging tax,
the Oklahoma tax commission shall be responsible for making refunds to
taxpayers previously collected by the Oklahoma tax commission on the city's
behalf in accordance with the guidelines, procedures and regulations previously
adopted by the Oklahoma tax commission.
      2.   City Collection Of Tax: The city manager shall direct the refund or
credit of any tax erroneously, illegally or unconstitutionally collected if
written application to the city manager for such refund is made within two (2)
years from the date of payment thereof. For like causes, and in the same
period, a refund may be so made upon the initiative of the city manager,
subject to existing limits on the authority of the city manager as to amount.
The city manager, in lieu of any refund required to be made, may allow credit
thereof on payments due from the applicant. Whenever a refund is made, the
reasons therefor shall be stated in writing. Such application may be made by
the person who has collected and paid such tax to the city treasurer; however,
no refund of money shall be made to the operator until the operator has repaid
to the occupant the amount for which the application for refund is made.
         a.   Determination And Hearing: Upon application for a refund the city
manager may receive evidence with respect thereto, and make such investigation
as is deemed necessary. After making a determination as to the refund, the city
manager shall give written notice thereof to the applicant. Such determination
shall be final unless the applicant, within thirty (30) days after such notice,
shall apply in writing to the city council for a hearing. After such hearing
the city council shall give written notice of its decision to the applicant.
(Ord. 313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-1-2015)
3-2C-10: NOTICES:
Notices provided for under this article shall be deemed to have been given when
such notice has been delivered personally to the operator or deposited in the
United States mail, postage prepaid, to the last known address of the operator.
In the absence of written evidence received by the city to the contrary, the
last known address shall be presumed to be the address shown on the certificate
of registration as required by section
3-2C-14 of this article. (Ord. 313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-1-2015)
3-2C-11: REMEDIES EXCLUSIVE:
The remedies provided in this article shall be the exclusive remedies available
to any person for the review of tax liability imposed by this article. (Ord.
313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-1-2015)
3-2C-12: AGREEMENT OF ADMINISTRATION:
Upon approval of the tax by a majority of the qualified voters of the city, the
city shall be authorized, but not obligated, to enter into an agreement of
administration (the "agreement") with the Oklahoma tax commission for
collection of the tax levied hereunder. Should the city elect to enter into
said agreement, operators shall follow the normal rules and procedures of
collection and administration of excise tax as prescribed by the Oklahoma tax
commission. In the event of a subsequent change in administration and
collection of the tax, operators shall be notified in accordance with the
notice provisions required under state law and the rules of the Oklahoma tax
commission of the date of such change in collection practices and any
requirements of operators enumerated under this article where the city shall
serve as the collector of the tax. (Ord. 313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-1-2015)
3-2C-13: GENERAL POWERS OF THE CITY MANAGER:
In addition to all other powers granted to the city manager, the city manager
is hereby authorized:
   A.   To make, adopt and amend rules and regulations appropriate to the
execution of this article and for the purposes hereof;
   B.   To extend for cause shown the time for filing any return for a period
not exceeding thirty (30) days; and for cause shown to waive, remit, or reduce
penalties or interest;
   C.   To delegate functions hereunder to authorized designees for the city;
   D.   To assess, reassess, determine, revise and readjust the amount of taxes
(but not the tax rate) imposed by this article;
   E.   To prescribe methods for determining the taxable and nontaxable rents;
   F.   To administer oaths and take affidavits concerning any matter or
proceeding under this article; and
   G.   To subpoena and require the attendance of witnesses and the production
of books, papers and documents to secure information pertinent to the
performance and the enforcement of this article and to examine them in relation
thereto. (Ord. 313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-1-2015)
3-2C-14: CERTIFICATES OF REGISTRATION:
Every operator shall file with the city manager a certificate of registration
in a form prescribed by the city manager within ten (10) days after the
effective date hereof, or in the case of operators commencing business or
opening new hotels after such effective date, within three (3) days after such
commencement or opening. The city manager shall, within five (5) days after
such registration, issue, without charge, to each operator a certificate of
authority empowering such operator to collect the tax from the occupant and
duplicates thereof for each additional hotel. Each certificate or duplicate
shall state the hotel to which it is applicable. Such certificate of authority
shall be permanently displayed by the operator in such manner that it may be
seen and will come to the notice of all occupants and persons seeking
occupancy. Such certificates shall be nonassignable, nontransferable, and shall
be surrendered immediately to the city manager upon the cessation of business
at the hotel named, or upon its sale or transfer. (Ord. 313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-
1-2015)
3-2C-15: USE OF FUNDS:
All taxes collected pursuant to provisions of this article shall be placed in
the general funds of the city, shall be budgeted and appropriated annually by
the city, and shall be expended exclusively for the support of the functions of
the municipal government of the city (the "authorized purpose"), for the use
and benefit of the city and any public trust having the city as beneficiary
thereof and/or for the payment of debt service in connection with obligations
heretofore issued or to be issued to finance or refinance expenditures and
related costs for such authorized purpose. (Ord. 313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-1-2015)
3-2C-16: RECORDS CONFIDENTIAL:
The confidential and privileged nature of the records file concerning the
administration of the hotel tax is legislatively recognized and declared and,
in order to protect the same, the provisions of 68 Oklahoma Statutes 2011,
section 205 of the state sales tax code, and each subsection thereof and all
amendments thereto, as hereby adopted by reference and made fully effective and
applicable to the administration of this article as if here set forth. (Ord.
313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-1-2015)
3-2C-17: CRIMINAL PENALTIES:
   A.   The wilful intent or refusal of any taxpayer to make reports and
remittances therein required, or the making of any false and fraudulent report
for the purpose of avoiding or escaping payment of any tax or portion thereof
rightfully due under this article, shall constitute a violation of this code
and shall be subject to the general penalty set forth in section
1-4-1 of this code.
   B.   The failure by an operator to file a security bond as required, to
register or to display the certificate of registration, or to separately state
the tax on the bill or to collect such tax from the occupant, shall constitute
a violation of this code and shall be subject to the general penalty set forth
in section
1-4-1 of this code. (Ord. 313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-1-2015)
3-2C-18: CIVIL REMEDIES:
   A.   Whenever any operator, occupant or other person shall fail to collect
and/or pay over any tax, or to owe any tax, penalty or interest imposed by this
article as herein provided, the mayor may authorize the director of finance to
file notice of liens on behalf of the city against the real estate upon which
the hotel is located and/or against all franchises, property and rights to
property, whether real or personal, then belonging to or thereafter acquired by
the person owing the tax pursuant to 68 Oklahoma Statutes 2011, sections 2701
and 2704.
   B.   The liens shall, upon proper filing, attach to the real estate and/or
personal property then owned or thereafter acquired by the debtor, whether such
property is used by the debtor in the operation of business or is under the
authority of an assignee, trustee, or receiver for the benefit of creditors,
from the date such taxes are due and payable as allowed by 68 Oklahoma Statutes
2011, section 2704.
   C.   The city manager shall notify the person owing the tax by personal
service or by certified mail that the city will file such liens if any
delinquent taxes, interest and/or penalties are not paid within fifteen (15)
days of receiving such notice.
   D.   The city manager may also authorize the city attorney to institute an
action in personam and in rem to enforce payment and collect any delinquent
taxes, penalties and/or interest. (Ord. 313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-1-2015)
ARTICLE A. SALES TAX
SECTION:
3-2A-1: Authority To Levy Taxes; Compliance With Statute
3-2A-2: Taxes Imposed; Effective Dates
3-2A-1: AUTHORITY TO LEVY TAXES; COMPLIANCE WITH STATUTE:
The city sales taxes shall be levied upon the gross receipts or gross proceeds
of such sales as specified by 68 Oklahoma Statutes section 1350 et seq., and
exemptions from such taxes shall be allowed pursuant to said statutes. (2002
Code)
3-2A-2: TAXES IMPOSED; EFFECTIVE DATES:
The following city sales taxes, in the total amount of four and one-half
percent (4.50%), shall be imposed and effective as indicated, unless otherwise
extended by a vote of the people. Said taxes have been approved by a majority
of the registered voters of the city voting on same in elections conducted in
the manner prescribed by Oklahoma Statutes: (2002 Code; amd. Ord. 247, 12-12-
2005)
   A.   Three percent (3%), effective in 1982, to provide revenue for the
following purposes:
      1.   Seventy five percent (75%) for street improvements; and
      2.   Twenty five percent (25%) for general purposes. (Ord. 154, 5-4-1982)
   B.   One-half of one percent (0.50%), effective December 1, 1994, for
operating revenue for the city. (Ord. 201, 9-6-1994; amd. 2002 Code)
   C.   1. Effective Date And Date Of Termination: Subject to approval of a
majority of the registered voters of the city of Drumright, Oklahoma, voting on
the same as prescribed by law, to be held on February 14, 2006, this ordinance
247 shall become effective immediately upon said approval and this ordinance
247 shall cease to be effective, and the existing one-half percent (1/2%)
excise tax and the additional one-half percent (1/2%) excise tax levied by
ordinance 211, as amended by ordinance 228, shall no longer be levied on and
after April 1, 2036.
      2.   Purposes Of Revenues: It hereby is declared to be the purpose of the
revenues provided by the existing one-half percent (1/2%) excise tax and the
additional one-half percent (1/2%) excise tax levied by this ordinance to
provide revenues for the purposes of paying the principal of and interest on
indebtedness incurred on behalf of the city of Drumright by the Drumright
utility trust to provide funds for capital improvements of the city of
Drumright, Oklahoma, and for paying the expenses of equipping, operating and
maintaining the municipal hospital facilities and properties owned by the city
of Drumright, Oklahoma. (Ord. 247, 12-12-2005)
ARTICLE B. USE TAX
SECTION:
3-2B-1: Statute Authority
3-2B-2: Tax Levied; Effective Date
3-2B-1: STATUTE AUTHORITY:
The city is hereby authorized, pursuant to 68 Oklahoma Statutes section 1401 et
seq., to levy an excise tax on the storage, use or other consumption of
tangible personal property used, stored or consumed within the city. (2002
Code)
3-2B-2: TAX LEVIED; EFFECTIVE DATE:
There is hereby levied, and there shall be paid by every person storing, using
or otherwise consuming within the city tangible personal property purchased or
brought into the city, an excise tax on the storage, use or other consumption
within the city of such property at the rate of the sales tax levied, imposed,
and in effect pursuant to the provisions of this code of the purchase price of
such property. (Ord. 248, 6-12-2006, eff. 7-1-2006)
ARTICLE C. LODGING TAX
SECTION:
3-2C-1: Citation And Codification
3-2C-2: Definitions
3-2C-3: Tax Rate
3-2C-4: Exemptions
3-2C-5: Tax To Be Separately Designated On Bills
3-2C-6: Operator's Duties
3-2C-7: Bond Required; City Collection
3-2C-8: Assessment And Determination Of Tax
3-2C-9: Refunds
3-2C-10: Notices
3-2C-11: Remedies Exclusive
3-2C-12: Agreement Of Administration
3-2C-13: General Powers Of The City Manager
3-2C-14: Certificates Of Registration
3-2C-15: Use Of Funds
3-2C-16: Records Confidential
3-2C-17: Criminal Penalties
3-2C-18: Civil Remedies
3-2C-1: CITATION AND CODIFICATION:
This article shall be known and cited as the CITY OF DRUMRIGHT LODGING TAX
ORDINANCE. (Ord. 313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-1-2015)
3-2C-2: DEFINITIONS:
As used in this article:
CITY: The city of Drumright, Oklahoma.
HOTEL: Any building or buildings, structures, trailer, or other facility in
which the public may, for consideration, obtain sleeping accommodations, and in
which rooms are used for the accommodation of such occupant whether such rooms
are in one or several structures. The term shall include hotels, apartment
hotels, motels, tourist courts, lodging houses, inns, rooming houses, and all
other facilities where rooms or sleeping facilities or space are furnished for
a consideration. The term shall not include hospitals, sanatoriums or nursing
homes.
OCCUPANCY: The use or possession, or the right to the use or possession of any
room or rooms in a hotel.
OCCUPANT: The person, who for a consideration, uses, possesses, or has the
right to the use or possession of any room or rooms in a hotel under any lease,
concession, permit, right of access, license to use, or other agreement.
OPERATOR: Any person operating a hotel within the city, including, but not
limited to, the owner, proprietor, manager, lessee, sublessee, mortgagee in
possession, licensee, or any other person otherwise operating such hotel.
PERSON: Any individual, corporation, company, partnership, voluntary
association, firm, club, society, organization or any other entity of whatever
kind or nature.
RENT: The consideration received for occupancy valued in money, whether
received in money or otherwise, including all receipts, cash credits, and
property or services of any kind or nature, and also any amount for which
credit is allowed by the operator to the occupant, without any deduction
therefrom whatsoever.
RETURN: Any report filed or required to be filed as herein provided.
ROOM: Any room or suite of rooms of any kind in any part or portion of a hotel
which is available for or let out for use or possessed for sleeping facilities.
TAX: The tax levied pursuant to this article. (Ord. 313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-1-
2015)
3-2C-3: TAX RATE:
There is hereby levied an excise tax of four percent (4%) (in addition to any
and all other excise taxes now in force) upon the gross proceeds or gross
receipts derived from all rent for every occupancy of a room or rooms in a
hotel in this city. Rooms provided free of charge, through barter, trade or any
other arrangement or agreement of any kind or nature, are also subject to such
tax at the sales value of the room so provided (with "sales value" to mean the
price at which the room would be rented to the operator's best customer in the
ordinary course of business). (Ord. 313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-1-2015)
3-2C-4: EXEMPTIONS:
The exemptions from excise tax enumerated in 68 Oklahoma Statutes, section 1350
et seq. (the "Oklahoma sales tax code"), are hereby adopted and incorporated
herein by reference. To the extent any conflicts in connection with the
permitted exemptions should arise under this article and the Oklahoma sales tax
code, the Oklahoma sales tax code shall prevail. (Ord. 313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-
1-2015)
3-2C-5: TAX TO BE SEPARATELY DESIGNATED ON BILLS:
The operator shall separately designate; charge and show the tax on all bills,
statements, receipts or any other evidence of charge or payment of rent for
occupancy issued or delivered by the operator. (Ord. 313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-1-
2015)
3-2C-6: OPERATOR'S DUTIES:
   A.   Operator Responsible For Collections: The operator shall be responsible
for the collection of the tax from the occupant and shall be liable to the city
for the tax which shall be held in trust by the operator until paid to the city
or the Oklahoma tax commission pursuant to an agreement to collect municipal
lodging taxes as set forth in 68 Oklahoma Statutes, section 2701 et seq., of
the state tax code. The operator shall join the city as a party to any action
brought by the operator to enforce collection of the tax.
   B.   Records To Be Kept: Every operator shall keep records of every
occupancy and of all rent paid, charged, or due thereon and of the tax payable
thereon in such form as the city manager or Oklahoma tax commission may by
regulation require. Such records shall be available for inspection and
examination at any time upon demand by the city manager, or a duty authorized
agent or employee of the city or the Oklahoma tax commission, and shall be
preserved for a period of three (3) years.
   C.   Returns:
      1.   In the event of collection of the tax levied pursuant to this
article by the Oklahoma tax commission, each operator shall file with the city
manager a copy of their completed Oklahoma state sales tax form within twenty
(20) days after the end of each month following the effective date hereof.
      2.   In the event of collection of the tax levied pursuant to this
article by the city, every operator shall file with the city manager a return
as prescribed by the city and shall contain such information as may be deemed
necessary and proper for the administration of this article, of any occupancy
and of rents, and of the taxes payable thereon for the period ending on the
last day of each month following the effective date hereof. Such return shall
be filed within the first twenty (20) days after the end of each such month.
The city manager may require amended returns to be filed within ten (10) days
after notice and to contain the information specified in the notice.
   D.   Payment Of Tax: The payment of the tax levied pursuant to this article
shall be due prior to the twentieth day following the month during which the
charge for the occupancy of a hotel is incurred by the occupant. At the time of
filing a return of occupancy and of rents, each operator shall pay to the city
treasurer or the Oklahoma tax commission (in the manner and form prescribed for
payment of the municipal lodging tax under the state tax law of the state of
Oklahoma) the taxes imposed by this article upon the rents included in such
return. All taxes not paid with a timely return shall be delinquent. All the
taxes for the period for which a return is required to be filed shall be due
from the operator and payable to the city treasurer or Oklahoma tax commission
on or before the date fixed for the filing of the return for such period
without regard to whether a return is filed or whether the return which is
filed correctly shows the amount of rents and the taxes due thereon.
   E.   Deduction For Recordkeeping: For so long as the operator maintains
compliance with the collection and remittance of the tax due hereunder, the
operator shall be allowed a deduction in accordance with the provisions of 68
Oklahoma Statutes, as amended, section 1367.1, as compensation for the keeping
and maintaining of sales tax records, filing reports and remitting the tax when
due.
   F.   Delinquent Taxes: All taxes not paid within twenty (20) calendar days
following the last day of the period for the collection of the tax levied by
this article shall be delinquent.
   G.   Interest And Penalties On Unpaid Taxes: If any tax levied by this
article becomes delinquent, the person responsible and liable for remittance of
such tax shall pay penalties on such unpaid tax at the rates and charges as
established in 68 Oklahoma Statutes, section 217. (Ord. 313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-
1-2015)
3-2C-7: BOND REQUIRED; CITY COLLECTION:
In the event initial collection of the tax levied hereunder shall be collected
by the city, or after such termination of an agreement of administration
authorized in section
3-2C-12 of this article, where the city manager believes that any operator is
about to cease business, leave the state, or remove or dissipate assets, or for
any other similar reason the city manager deems it necessary in order to
protect revenues under this article may require such operator to file with the
city a bond issued by a surety company authorized to transact business in the
state in such amount as the city manager may fix to secure the payment of any
tax or penalties and interest due, or which may become due from such operator.
In the event that the city manager determines that an operator is to file such
bond, the city manager shall give notice to such operator specifying the amount
of security required. The operator shall file such security as a performance
bond or irrevocable letter of credit within five (5) days after the filing of
such notice unless within such five (5) days the operator shall request in
writing a hearing before the city council, at which time the necessary
propriety and amount of the bond shall be determined by the city council. Such
determination shall be final and shall be complied with within fifteen (15)
days thereafter. In lieu of such bond, a cash or securities escrow, in an
amount and under terms approved by the city manager, may be deposited with the
city manager, who may at any time after five (5) days' notice to the depositor,
apply them to any tax and/or any penalties due and for that purpose the
securities may be sold at private or public sale. (Ord. 313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-
1-2015)
3-2C-8: ASSESSMENT AND DETERMINATION OF TAX:
If a return required by this article is not filed, or if a return when filed is
incorrect or insufficient, the amount of tax due shall be assessed by the city
manager or the Oklahoma tax commission from such information as may be
obtainable and, if necessary, the tax may be estimated on the basis of external
indices, such as number of rooms, location, scale of rents, comparable rents,
types of accommodations and services, number of employees, or other factors.
Written notice of such assessments shall be given to the person liable for the
collection and payment of the tax. Such assessment shall finally and
irrevocably fix and determine the tax:
   A.   Unless the person against whom it is assessed shall apply in writing to
the city council for a hearing within sixty (60) days after the city gives
notice of such assessment; or
   B.   Unless the city manager decides to reassess the same.
After such hearing, the city council shall give written notice of its
determination within thirty (30) days to the person against whom the tax is
assessed and such determination shall be final. (Ord. 313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-1-
2015)
3-2C-9: REFUNDS:
   A.   Procedure:
      1.   Oklahoma Tax Commission Collection Of Tax: If collection of the tax
levied pursuant to this article is delegated to the Oklahoma tax commission
pursuant to an agreement for the collection of municipally imposed lodging tax,
the Oklahoma tax commission shall be responsible for making refunds to
taxpayers previously collected by the Oklahoma tax commission on the city's
behalf in accordance with the guidelines, procedures and regulations previously
adopted by the Oklahoma tax commission.
      2.   City Collection Of Tax: The city manager shall direct the refund or
credit of any tax erroneously, illegally or unconstitutionally collected if
written application to the city manager for such refund is made within two (2)
years from the date of payment thereof. For like causes, and in the same
period, a refund may be so made upon the initiative of the city manager,
subject to existing limits on the authority of the city manager as to amount.
The city manager, in lieu of any refund required to be made, may allow credit
thereof on payments due from the applicant. Whenever a refund is made, the
reasons therefor shall be stated in writing. Such application may be made by
the person who has collected and paid such tax to the city treasurer; however,
no refund of money shall be made to the operator until the operator has repaid
to the occupant the amount for which the application for refund is made.
         a.   Determination And Hearing: Upon application for a refund the city
manager may receive evidence with respect thereto, and make such investigation
as is deemed necessary. After making a determination as to the refund, the city
manager shall give written notice thereof to the applicant. Such determination
shall be final unless the applicant, within thirty (30) days after such notice,
shall apply in writing to the city council for a hearing. After such hearing
the city council shall give written notice of its decision to the applicant.
(Ord. 313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-1-2015)
3-2C-10: NOTICES:
Notices provided for under this article shall be deemed to have been given when
such notice has been delivered personally to the operator or deposited in the
United States mail, postage prepaid, to the last known address of the operator.
In the absence of written evidence received by the city to the contrary, the
last known address shall be presumed to be the address shown on the certificate
of registration as required by section
3-2C-14 of this article. (Ord. 313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-1-2015)
3-2C-11: REMEDIES EXCLUSIVE:
The remedies provided in this article shall be the exclusive remedies available
to any person for the review of tax liability imposed by this article. (Ord.
313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-1-2015)
3-2C-12: AGREEMENT OF ADMINISTRATION:
Upon approval of the tax by a majority of the qualified voters of the city, the
city shall be authorized, but not obligated, to enter into an agreement of
administration (the "agreement") with the Oklahoma tax commission for
collection of the tax levied hereunder. Should the city elect to enter into
said agreement, operators shall follow the normal rules and procedures of
collection and administration of excise tax as prescribed by the Oklahoma tax
commission. In the event of a subsequent change in administration and
collection of the tax, operators shall be notified in accordance with the
notice provisions required under state law and the rules of the Oklahoma tax
commission of the date of such change in collection practices and any
requirements of operators enumerated under this article where the city shall
serve as the collector of the tax. (Ord. 313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-1-2015)
3-2C-13: GENERAL POWERS OF THE CITY MANAGER:
In addition to all other powers granted to the city manager, the city manager
is hereby authorized:
   A.   To make, adopt and amend rules and regulations appropriate to the
execution of this article and for the purposes hereof;
   B.   To extend for cause shown the time for filing any return for a period
not exceeding thirty (30) days; and for cause shown to waive, remit, or reduce
penalties or interest;
   C.   To delegate functions hereunder to authorized designees for the city;
   D.   To assess, reassess, determine, revise and readjust the amount of taxes
(but not the tax rate) imposed by this article;
   E.   To prescribe methods for determining the taxable and nontaxable rents;
   F.   To administer oaths and take affidavits concerning any matter or
proceeding under this article; and
   G.   To subpoena and require the attendance of witnesses and the production
of books, papers and documents to secure information pertinent to the
performance and the enforcement of this article and to examine them in relation
thereto. (Ord. 313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-1-2015)
3-2C-14: CERTIFICATES OF REGISTRATION:
Every operator shall file with the city manager a certificate of registration
in a form prescribed by the city manager within ten (10) days after the
effective date hereof, or in the case of operators commencing business or
opening new hotels after such effective date, within three (3) days after such
commencement or opening. The city manager shall, within five (5) days after
such registration, issue, without charge, to each operator a certificate of
authority empowering such operator to collect the tax from the occupant and
duplicates thereof for each additional hotel. Each certificate or duplicate
shall state the hotel to which it is applicable. Such certificate of authority
shall be permanently displayed by the operator in such manner that it may be
seen and will come to the notice of all occupants and persons seeking
occupancy. Such certificates shall be nonassignable, nontransferable, and shall
be surrendered immediately to the city manager upon the cessation of business
at the hotel named, or upon its sale or transfer. (Ord. 313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-
1-2015)
3-2C-15: USE OF FUNDS:
All taxes collected pursuant to provisions of this article shall be placed in
the general funds of the city, shall be budgeted and appropriated annually by
the city, and shall be expended exclusively for the support of the functions of
the municipal government of the city (the "authorized purpose"), for the use
and benefit of the city and any public trust having the city as beneficiary
thereof and/or for the payment of debt service in connection with obligations
heretofore issued or to be issued to finance or refinance expenditures and
related costs for such authorized purpose. (Ord. 313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-1-2015)
3-2C-16: RECORDS CONFIDENTIAL:
The confidential and privileged nature of the records file concerning the
administration of the hotel tax is legislatively recognized and declared and,
in order to protect the same, the provisions of 68 Oklahoma Statutes 2011,
section 205 of the state sales tax code, and each subsection thereof and all
amendments thereto, as hereby adopted by reference and made fully effective and
applicable to the administration of this article as if here set forth. (Ord.
313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-1-2015)
3-2C-17: CRIMINAL PENALTIES:
   A.   The wilful intent or refusal of any taxpayer to make reports and
remittances therein required, or the making of any false and fraudulent report
for the purpose of avoiding or escaping payment of any tax or portion thereof
rightfully due under this article, shall constitute a violation of this code
and shall be subject to the general penalty set forth in section
1-4-1 of this code.
   B.   The failure by an operator to file a security bond as required, to
register or to display the certificate of registration, or to separately state
the tax on the bill or to collect such tax from the occupant, shall constitute
a violation of this code and shall be subject to the general penalty set forth
in section
1-4-1 of this code. (Ord. 313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-1-2015)
3-2C-18: CIVIL REMEDIES:
   A.   Whenever any operator, occupant or other person shall fail to collect
and/or pay over any tax, or to owe any tax, penalty or interest imposed by this
article as herein provided, the mayor may authorize the director of finance to
file notice of liens on behalf of the city against the real estate upon which
the hotel is located and/or against all franchises, property and rights to
property, whether real or personal, then belonging to or thereafter acquired by
the person owing the tax pursuant to 68 Oklahoma Statutes 2011, sections 2701
and 2704.
   B.   The liens shall, upon proper filing, attach to the real estate and/or
personal property then owned or thereafter acquired by the debtor, whether such
property is used by the debtor in the operation of business or is under the
authority of an assignee, trustee, or receiver for the benefit of creditors,
from the date such taxes are due and payable as allowed by 68 Oklahoma Statutes
2011, section 2704.
   C.   The city manager shall notify the person owing the tax by personal
service or by certified mail that the city will file such liens if any
delinquent taxes, interest and/or penalties are not paid within fifteen (15)
days of receiving such notice.
   D.   The city manager may also authorize the city attorney to institute an
action in personam and in rem to enforce payment and collect any delinquent
taxes, penalties and/or interest. (Ord. 313, 2-9-2015, eff. 10-1-2015)
CHAPTER 3
ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES
ARTICLE A. OCCUPATION TAX
SECTION:
3-3A-1: Definitions
3-3A-2: Taxes Levied
3-3A-3: Payment Required; Penalty
3-3A-4: Annual Report
3-3A-5: Certificate Requirements
3-3A-6: Tax Receipt Posted
3-3A-7: Tax Recoverable By Suit
3-3A-8: Penalty
3-3A-1: DEFINITIONS:
   A.   Terms Defined: Words and terms within this article and articles B and C
of this chapter, shall be given the same meanings and definitions set forth for
them by the Oklahoma alcoholic beverage control act, 37 Oklahoma Statutes
section 506. (2002 Code)
   B.   Requirements: Persons engaged in occupations relating to alcoholic
beverages shall do those things specified in the Oklahoma alcoholic beverage
control act, 37 Oklahoma Statutes section 521.
   C.   Word Usage: Words in the plural include the singular, and vice versa,
and words imparting the masculine gender include the feminine. (1980 Code § 2-
1; amd. 2002 Code)
3-3A-2: TAXES LEVIED:
   A.   Taxes Enumerated: There is hereby levied and assessed an annual
occupation tax on every business or occupation relating to alcoholic beverages
as specifically enumerated herein and in the amount herein stated:
Brewer                 $1,250.00
Caterer                 
(Initial)              1,000.00
(Renewal)              900.00
Class B wholesaler     625.00
Distiller              3,125.00
Mixed beverage
(Initial)              450.00
(Renewal)              450.00
Oklahoma winemaker     75.00
Rectifier              3,125.00
Retail package store   450.00
Special event, per day 50.00
Wholesaler             3,500.00
Winemaker              625.00
 
   B.   Service Organizations: The occupation tax for those service
organizations which are exempt under section 501(c)(19) of the internal revenue
code for mixed beverage or bottle club license shall be five hundred dollars
($500.00) per year.
   C.   Brewer Or Class B Wholesaler: If a brewer or a class B wholesaler also
holds a license from the state to manufacture or wholesale any nonintoxicating
malt beverage, then the occupation tax for such brewer or class B wholesaler
shall be reduced by seventy five percent (75%). (1980 Code § 2-2)
3-3A-3: PAYMENT REQUIRED; PENALTY:
   A.   State License Prerequisite: Any state licensee originally entering upon
any occupation herein listed shall pay the tax therefor at the office of the
city clerk on or before the date upon which he enters upon such occupation. The
licensee shall provide a copy of his current state license before payment of an
occupation tax will be accepted. Thereafter, the licensee shall pay the tax
annually on or before July 1.
   B.   Prorate Tax: The occupation tax subject to this chapter shall be
prorated on a monthly basis for the year in which an occupation begins
operations.
   C.   Issue Receipt: Upon payment of the occupation tax, the city clerk shall
issue a receipt to the state licensee, which the licensee shall post in a
conspicuous place on the premises wherein he carried on his occupation. (1980
Code § 2-3)
   D.   Penalty For Nonpayment: Any person who engages in any of the
occupations taxed by this article without paying the occupation tax imposed
therefor in advance of such operation is guilty of an offense against the city
and, upon conviction thereof, shall be subject to penalty as provided in
section
1-4-1 of this code. Each day of such violation shall constitute a separate
offense. (1980 Code § 2-3; amd. 2002 Code)
3-3A-4: ANNUAL REPORT:
The city clerk shall make an annual report to the ABLE commission, covering the
fiscal year, showing the number and class of licensees subject to the
occupation tax and the amount of money collected from the tax. (1980 Code § 2-
3.1)
3-3A-5: CERTIFICATE REQUIREMENTS:
   A.   Application For Certificate; Investigations:
      1.   Every applicant for a certificate of compliance with the zoning,
fire, health and safety codes of the city required by title 37 of the Oklahoma
Statutes shall apply at the office of the city clerk by:
         a.   Filing a written application on forms prescribed by that office;
and
         b.   Paying a verification and certification fee.
      2.   Upon receipt of an application for a certificate of compliance, the
city clerk shall cause an investigation to be made to determine whether the
premises proposed for licensed operations comply with the provisions of the
zoning ordinance and any health, fire, building and other safety codes
applicable to it.
      3.   The city clerk shall act on all such applications within twenty (20)
days of receipt thereof. (1980 Code § 2-3.2; amd. 2002 Code)
   B.   Issuance Of Certificate Of Zoning And Certificate Of Compliance:
      1.   Upon finding that the premises of an applicant for a certificate is
in compliance with all applicable zoning ordinances, a certificate of zoning
shall be issued to the ABLE commission.
      2.   Upon finding that the premises of an applicant for a certificate is
in compliance with all applicable fire, safety, and health codes, a certificate
of compliance shall be issued to the ABLE commission.
      3.   The above certificates of compliance shall be signed by the mayor or
by the vice mayor. (1980 Code § 2-3.4)
3-3A-6: TAX RECEIPT POSTED:
Any state licensee shall post his tax receipt in a conspicuous place in the
premises wherein he carries on his occupation. (1980 Code § 2-4)
3-3A-7: TAX RECOVERABLE BY SUIT:
All sums due from any person by reason of occupation taxes imposed by this
article and all penalties occurring from such person by reason of failure to
pay such tax shall be recoverable at the suit of the city brought against such
person in any court of competent jurisdiction. In any such suit, in addition to
the tax and penalties, the plaintiff shall recover interest, at the rate of ten
percent (10%) per annum upon all sums due by way of tax and penalty from the
date of accrual thereof, and all costs of collection, judicial or otherwise,
including reasonable attorney fees (which shall be paid to the attorney
representing the plaintiff in the suit), all to be determined by the court.
Prosecution for an offense against the city arising out of the failure to pay a
tax levied by this article, regardless of the outcome thereof or of its
continued pendency, shall not constitute a defense or a bar in any manner to
the collection of the tax and penalties, if any are due, as herein provided.
(1980 Code § 2-6)
3-3A-8: PENALTY:
Any person who engages in any one of the occupations taxed by this article
without paying the occupation tax imposed therefor is guilty of an offense
against the city and, upon conviction thereof, shall be subject to penalty as
provided in section
1-4-1 of this code. Each day that such person engages in the occupation without
payment of the tax shall constitute a separate offense. (1980 Code § 2-5; amd.
2002 Code)
ARTICLE A. OCCUPATION TAX
SECTION:
3-3A-1: Definitions
3-3A-2: Taxes Levied
3-3A-3: Payment Required; Penalty
3-3A-4: Annual Report

3-3A-6: Tax Receipt Posted
3-3A-7: Tax Recoverable By Suit
3-3A-8: Penalty

city clerk on or before the date upon which he enters upon such occupation. The
licensee shall provide a copy of his current state license before payment of an
occupation tax will be accepted. Thereafter, the licensee shall pay the tax
annually on or before July 1.
   B.   Prorate Tax: The occupation tax subject to this chapter shall be
prorated on a monthly basis for the year in which an occupation begins
operations.
   C.   Issue Receipt: Upon payment of the occupation tax, the city clerk shall
issue a receipt to the state licensee, which the licensee shall post in a
conspicuous place on the premises wherein he carried on his occupation. (1980
Code § 2-3)
   D.   Penalty For Nonpayment: Any person who engages in any of the
occupations taxed by this article without paying the occupation tax imposed
therefor in advance of such operation is guilty of an offense against the city
and, upon conviction thereof, shall be subject to penalty as provided in
section
1-4-1 of this code. Each day of such violation shall constitute a separate
offense. (1980 Code § 2-3; amd. 2002 Code)
3-3A-4: ANNUAL REPORT:
The city clerk shall make an annual report to the ABLE commission, covering the
fiscal year, showing the number and class of licensees subject to the
occupation tax and the amount of money collected from the tax. (1980 Code § 2-
3.1)
3-3A-5: CERTIFICATE REQUIREMENTS:
   A.   Application For Certificate; Investigations:
      1.   Every applicant for a certificate of compliance with the zoning,
fire, health and safety codes of the city required by title 37 of the Oklahoma
Statutes shall apply at the office of the city clerk by:
         a.   Filing a written application on forms prescribed by that office;
and
         b.   Paying a verification and certification fee.
      2.   Upon receipt of an application for a certificate of compliance, the
city clerk shall cause an investigation to be made to determine whether the
premises proposed for licensed operations comply with the provisions of the
zoning ordinance and any health, fire, building and other safety codes
applicable to it.
      3.   The city clerk shall act on all such applications within twenty (20)
days of receipt thereof. (1980 Code § 2-3.2; amd. 2002 Code)
   B.   Issuance Of Certificate Of Zoning And Certificate Of Compliance:
      1.   Upon finding that the premises of an applicant for a certificate is
in compliance with all applicable zoning ordinances, a certificate of zoning
shall be issued to the ABLE commission.
      2.   Upon finding that the premises of an applicant for a certificate is
in compliance with all applicable fire, safety, and health codes, a certificate
of compliance shall be issued to the ABLE commission.
      3.   The above certificates of compliance shall be signed by the mayor or
by the vice mayor. (1980 Code § 2-3.4)
3-3A-6: TAX RECEIPT POSTED:
Any state licensee shall post his tax receipt in a conspicuous place in the
premises wherein he carries on his occupation. (1980 Code § 2-4)
3-3A-7: TAX RECOVERABLE BY SUIT:
All sums due from any person by reason of occupation taxes imposed by this
article and all penalties occurring from such person by reason of failure to
pay such tax shall be recoverable at the suit of the city brought against such
person in any court of competent jurisdiction. In any such suit, in addition to
the tax and penalties, the plaintiff shall recover interest, at the rate of ten
percent (10%) per annum upon all sums due by way of tax and penalty from the
date of accrual thereof, and all costs of collection, judicial or otherwise,
including reasonable attorney fees (which shall be paid to the attorney
representing the plaintiff in the suit), all to be determined by the court.
Prosecution for an offense against the city arising out of the failure to pay a
tax levied by this article, regardless of the outcome thereof or of its
continued pendency, shall not constitute a defense or a bar in any manner to
the collection of the tax and penalties, if any are due, as herein provided.
(1980 Code § 2-6)
3-3A-8: PENALTY:
Any person who engages in any one of the occupations taxed by this article
without paying the occupation tax imposed therefor is guilty of an offense
against the city and, upon conviction thereof, shall be subject to penalty as
provided in section
1-4-1 of this code. Each day that such person engages in the occupation without
payment of the tax shall constitute a separate offense. (1980 Code § 2-5; amd.
2002 Code)
ARTICLE B. MANUFACTURE, SALE AND DISTRIBUTION
SECTION:
3-3B-1: Purpose
3-3B-2: Definitions
3-3B-3: Signs; Advertising
3-3B-4: Separate Premises Required; Restrictions
3-3B-5: Sales And Consumption In Retail Stores
3-3B-6: Location Of Stores
3-3B-7: Under Age Persons; Restrictions
3-3B-8: Sales To Certain Persons
3-3B-9: Transportation Of Liquor
3-3B-10: Drinking In Public; Intoxicated Persons
3-3B-11: Days And Hours Of Operation
3-3B-12: Sales On Credit
3-3B-13: Offering Prizes Or Gifts
3-3B-14: Penalty
3-3B-1: PURPOSE:
This article is enacted as an exercise of the police power of the city to
preserve the public peace, safety, health, and good order thereof, and to aid
the enforcement of the policy of the state, as established by the Oklahoma
alcoholic beverage control act 1 . (1980 Code § 2-8)
 
Notes
1 1. 37 OS.
3-3B-2: DEFINITIONS:
Words and terms within article A of this chapter, this article and article C of
this chapter, shall be given the same meanings and definitions set forth for
them by the Oklahoma alcoholic beverage control act, 37 Oklahoma Statutes
section 506. (2002 Code)
3-3B-3: SIGNS; ADVERTISING:
   A.   Sign Restrictions: No person owning, operating, or maintaining a retail
alcoholic beverage store shall cause or permit it to be designated by more than
one sign, which shall contain only the words "Retail Alcoholic Liquor Store",
or any combination of such words, or any of them, and which shall contain no
letter or figure more than four inches (4") in height or more than three inches
(3") in width, and in which the lines of words, if more than one, shall not be
more than one inch (1") apart. (1980 Code § 2-10)
   B.   Advertising Restricted: No person shall advertise, or cause to be
advertised, in any manner, other than as authorized by subsection A of this
section, the sale of alcoholic beverages within the limits of the city, except
as authorized by law. (1980 Code § 2-11)
3-3B-4: SEPARATE PREMISES REQUIRED; RESTRICTIONS:
   A.   Separation From Adjoining Premises: No person shall maintain, operate,
or assist, in any manner, the maintenance or operation of a retail alcoholic
beverage store or package store in premises which is not separated from
adjoining premises on which any other goods, wares, or merchandise is sold or
services are rendered by nontransparent walls, broken only, if at all, by a
passageway to which the public is not admitted. (1980 Code § 2-12)
   B.   Taking Beverages Through Passageway: No person shall take any alcoholic
beverage through any passageway described in subsection A of this section, for
the purpose of selling or reselling such beverage, or for the purpose of
delivery thereof in connection with a sale of such beverages. (1980 Code § 2-
13)
3-3B-5: SALES AND CONSUMPTION IN RETAIL STORES:
   A.   Sales:
      1.   No person shall sell or deliver alcoholic beverages at a retail
alcoholic beverage store other than:
         a.   In retail containers;
         b.   At ordinary room temperatures;
         c.   In the original package; and
         d.   For consumption off the premises.
No person owning, employed in, or in any manner assisting in the maintenance
and operation of such store shall suffer or permit any alcoholic beverage to be
consumed, or any retail container of such beverage to be opened on the premises
of such store. (1980 Code § 2-14)
      2.   No person shall sell at retail, and no person shall deliver in
consequence or in completion of such sale, any alcoholic beverages at any place
in the city, except at a retail alcoholic beverage store or as otherwise
permitted by the city and the laws of the state. (1980 Code § 2-16)
   B.   Consumption On Premises: No person shall drink or consume in any manner
alcoholic beverages on the premises of a retail alcoholic beverage store, nor
shall any person open or break the seal of any original package or retail
container containing alcoholic beverages on the premises of any such retail
alcoholic beverage store. (1980 Code § 2-15)
3-3B-6: LOCATION OF STORES:
   A.   Area Zoned For Location: No retail alcoholic beverage store shall be
located, maintained or operated by any person at any time within the boundaries
of the city, except on Broadway Street, from its intersection with Haven Hill
east to its intersection with Oklahoma Street, and on the north side of
Broadway Street beginning at the intersection of Broadway Street with Oklahoma
Street and continuing from the east boundary line of Oklahoma Street a distance
of three hundred feet (300') in an easterly direction along the north side of
Broadway Street in the city; on Ohio Street, from its intersection with
Drumright Street, south to its intersection with Fulkerson Street; and on
Pennsylvania Street from Broadway, south to Fulkerson Street, and the foregoing
areas shall be the areas within the city zoned for the location of said retail
alcoholic beverage store, except insofar as said areas are limited or
prohibited by state law.
   B.   Location In Accordance With Law: No person shall own, operate,
maintain, or be interested in any retail alcoholic beverage store which is
located at a place within the city which is forbidden as a location for such
store by the laws of the state. (Ord. 304, 11-12-2013)
3-3B-7: UNDERAGE PERSONS; RESTRICTIONS:
   A.   Selling Or Furnishing To Minor: No person shall knowingly sell,
deliver, or furnish alcoholic beverages, at any place within the city, to any
person who is under twenty one (21) years of age. (1980 Code § 2-19)
   B.   Misrepresentation Of Age: No person under twenty one (21) years of age
shall misrepresent his age in writing or present false documentation of age, or
otherwise, for the purpose of inducing any person to sell him alcoholic
beverages. (1980 Code § 2-20)
   C.   Employment:
      1.   No person under twenty one (21) years of age shall be employed in
the selling, manufacture, distribution, or other handling of alcoholic
beverages at any place within the city. (1980 Code § 2-24)
      2.   No person shall employ or assist or aid in causing the employment of
any person under the age of twenty one (21) years at any place within the city,
in the selling, manufacture, distribution, or other handling of alcoholic
beverages. (1980 Code § 2-25)
   D.   Entering, Remaining On Premises:
      1.   No owner or proprietor of a retail alcoholic beverage store in the
city, and no person employed therein, shall permit any person under twenty one
(21) years of age to enter into, to remain within, or to loiter about the
premises of such retail alcoholic beverage store. (1980 Code § 2-29)
      2.   No person under the age of twenty one (21) years shall enter into,
remain within, or loiter about the premises of any retail alcoholic beverage
store within the city. (1980 Code § 2-30)
3-3B-8: SALES TO CERTAIN PERSONS:
No person, at any place within the city, shall sell, deliver, or knowingly
furnish alcoholic beverage to an intoxicated person or to any person who has
been adjudged insane or mentally deficient. (1980 Code § 2-21)
3-3B-9: TRANSPORTATION OF LIQUOR:
No person within the city shall transport in any vehicle upon any public
highway, street, or alley any alcoholic beverage unless such alcoholic beverage
is:
   A.   In an unopened original container with seal unbroken and the original
cap or cork not removed from the container; or
   B.   In the trunk or other closed compartment or other container, out of
